primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The rescue of humanity from the cosmic dominion of Sin and Death by the singular intervention of Jesus Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ... has come to our rescue
He has quite literally appeared on the human scene with divine power to save
one man’s act of righteousness leads to acquittal and life for all men

object.identificatie: Acquittal, Life, and Liberation from the 'Empire of Evil'
tekstueel_bewijs: reign in life through the one man Jesus Christ
transferred from the dominion of death into the dominion of the Messiah

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: originates in the grace of the heavenly Father
news imparted to her by the Holy Spirit of God
much more have the grace of God... abounded for many
those who receive the abundance of grace

helper.identificatie: The Gospel Message / St. Paul / The Preacher
tekstueel_bewijs: Paul is trying to tell us that our life in Christ has been snatched out of the jaws of death
The preacher would be herself, were it not for the news
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit is the one who imparts the 'news' of the performance.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin and Death (Personified as reigning monarchs)
tekstueel_bewijs: Sin won dominion over all men
Sin and death... rule over us totally
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is treated as an objective, ontological power that 'seizes' and 'dislocates' human life, making escape impossible by human effort.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response of gratitude and 'entrusting' themselves to the Savior.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (faith/trust) is a response to the completed primary program (deliverance). The preacher explicitly states that deliverance causes the breakdown/gratitude.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Grace/Righteousness → The Many

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus Christ... has come to our rescue
God is making a new creation
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Will you grasp the great salvation?

voorbeelden: we must understand the terrible destiny
Paul wishes above all to enable us to be thus overcome
unless and until we make this story our own
we know these things only by faith
he alone is able to redeem us

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of 'Pouvoir' (power) in the human subject and the absolute 'Pouvoir' of Christ. Grace is presented as a transfer of power regimes.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (The terror of the tumor/death) to ~S2 (The 'clear' CAT scan/acquittal) and finally to S1 (Reigning in life).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Much More' of Christ's obedience swallowing the 'disobedience' of Adam.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'terminal' condition and an 'Empire of Evil'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is rigorously theocentric. It identifies the human condition as one of total inability and positions Christ as the sole active Subject of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Will you grasp the great salvation?

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ... has come to our rescue.
Sin and death... rule over us totally.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Adam is used as a 'typical man' or 'anti-type' of our condition, not a moral example to follow or avoid. Christ is the Savior, not an example.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already uses a theocentric reading: Christ does for us what we cannot do.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; the hearer is the beneficiary of an external rescue.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The personal narrative of the daughter's illness perfectly mirrors the theological narrative of Romans 5.
spanning_punten: The transition from the 'medical' metaphor to the 'legal' language of acquittal.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: transferred from the dominion of death into the dominion of the Messiah and his victory over every form of evil.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit imparts the 'news' which creates the 'Pouvoir' to trust.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'contagion' and a 'reigning monarch'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains Christ as the Subject and the hearer as the Receiver. It avoids the 'Helper' trap where God merely assists human effort.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance as it serves the 'Grace' focus.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Program 1) clearly precedes and enables Response (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses narrative semiotics to heighten the 'much more' of grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the emotional impact of the daughter's story, Greimas shows how that story functions as a 'modal competence' builder for the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 5; semiotics shows how the sermon 're-enacts' the transfer of dominion within the hearer's imagination.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'roller coaster' and 'tumor' stories are not just illustrations but actantial parallels that establish the 'Opponent' as insurmountable.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' almost perfectly, ensuring the active verbs of salvation belong to Christ.
